segments.text: I notice the woman standing by the sink, drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems so focused on her task, completely unaware of her surroundings.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, creating a puddle around her feet, but she doesn't even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the children behind her, up to no good, but she's completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's almost like she's in her own little world, lost in her thoughts.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder what she's thinking about, to be so distracted.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm and tidy, unlike the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a sense of frustration, wishing she would just turn around and notice what's happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But she's just standing there, drying dishes, completely unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel a bit sorry for her, missing out on the moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she snaps out of it soon, before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
